BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: HARTLAND INSTITUTE OF HEALTH AND EDUCATION

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: Educate, equip, and train missionaries to transform the world through Christ; a biblically based educational program that combines academics with practical training and outreach.
IRS990.MissionDesc: Educate, equip, and train missionaries to transform the world through Christ; a biblically based educational program that combines academics with practical training and outreach.
IRS990.Desc: College and Education: Enrollment in the college this year included an average of 40 students, including interns. Twelve graduates completed their courses of study. We are currently offering majors in areas of health ministry, media, religion, and education. A midwifery course has also been added. Classroom studies are combined with practical work experience to help provide a well-rounded education. Our day academy/elementary enrollment was 15 for the year.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Lifestyle Center: Conducted twelve 11-day/ 17-day live-in programs for recovery of lifestyle diseases naturally, with a total average of 70 guests. Several individual therapy sessions were also provided.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: Publications: Hartland publishes a monthly subscription magazine addressing issues that Christians face today. It is now read and spread on six continents. We currently have an average of 1500 active subscriptions, which includes bulk subscriptions. Other publications relevant to Christian living and healthful lifestyle are also offered.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: Other accomplishments included our Organic Farm and Summer Bible Youth Camp with an average attendance of 65 kids, plus 30 staff/volunteers.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: It is included in the Hartland College catalog/handbook and on our website as well.
Schedule E, Part I, Line 6 - Participation in funding from the Employee Retention Credit (ERC).

AccountActivitiesOutsideUSGrp.SpecificServicesProvidedTxt: For operation of a missionary training program in Dominican Republic.
Ongoing support for two educational missionary training programs in Hungary.
For operation of a missionary training program in Colombia.
Ongoing support for educational missionary training programs in South Africa, Nigeria and Botswana.

GrantsToOrgOutsideUSGrp.PurposeOfGrantTxt: Program operations: Ongoing support for two educational training programs in Hungary.
For operation of missionary training program in Colombia

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Schedule F, Part I, Line 2 - Hartland helps to raise funds for ministries that are started and operated by former staff at Hartland and by students who have completed their training here. Hartland maintains a close working relationship with these ministries. Many current students complete their internship at these affiliates.
